meanings.definition: Having a huge appetite; excessively eager
meanings.sent1: The voracious puppy quickly finished his food and looked around for more.
meanings.sent2: She is known for her voracious reading habits, always eager to start a new book.
meanings.sent3: The voracious squirrel stole all the nuts from the other animals, leaving them hungry.
meanings.sent4: His voracious curiosity led him to explore every corner of the museum.
meanings.sent5: The voracious waves of the ocean devoured the sandy beach during the storm.

meanings.definition: Consuming or eager to consume large amounts of food
meanings.sent1: The voracious bear ate all the berries in the forest in one sitting.
meanings.sent2: After the hike, they had a voracious appetite and devoured the entire pizza.
meanings.sent3: The voracious toddler managed to eat all the cookies on the plate in record time.
meanings.sent4: The voracious fire consumed the entire forest in a matter of hours.
meanings.sent5: The voracious crowd at the buffet quickly emptied all the trays of food.

meanings.definition: Greedy in eating; very eager to eat a lot of food
meanings.sent1: The voracious raccoon raided the campsite's food supplies every night.
meanings.sent2: She had a voracious appetite for desserts and could never resist a slice of cake.
meanings.sent3: The voracious seagull swooped down and stole the sandwich right from his hand.
meanings.sent4: His voracious hunger for success drove him to work tirelessly towards his goals.
meanings.sent5: The voracious caterpillar ate through all the leaves on the plant in no time.
